item.title: 中国人民银行顾问称中国必须为经济做出 "重大贡献
item.description: 一位央行顾问表示，中国需要更大胆的支出计划来修补家庭和企业的财务状况，因为经济复苏的迹象掩盖了与美国的贸易战所造成的损害。【原文：China needs a bolder spending package to mend the finances of households and companies, according to a central bank adviser, as signs of resilience in the economy mask the damage wrought by the trade war with the US.】

item.title: 国债 10 月涨幅面临 CPI "临界点 "风险
item.description: 数据匮乏的债券交易员可能会看到，他们一直在等待的关键通胀数据破坏了 10 月份国债的涨势。【原文：Data-starved bond traders risk seeing the October rally in Treasuries spoiled by the key inflation figures they’ve been waiting for.】

item.title: 澳大利亚央行布洛克提出支付系统改革的优先事项
item.description: 澳大利亚储备银行行长米歇尔-布洛克（Michele Bullock）强调了政策制定者、政府和行业为实现国家支付系统现代化而开展工作的四个重点领域，同时重申了安全的重要性。【原文：Reserve Bank of Australia Governor Michele Bullock highlighted four key areas of focus in work between policymakers, the government and industry to modernize the nation’s payments system, while reiterating the importance of security.】

item.title: 古德尔称赞 NFL 私募股权投资举措，支持说唱歌手 Bad Bunny
item.description: 全美橄榄球联盟（National Football League）主席罗杰-古德尔（Roger Goodell）表示，私募股权投资在特许经营权所有权方面取得了 "令人难以置信的成功"，为球队带来了更大的财务灵活性和更多的发展潜力。【原文：National Football League Commissioner Roger Goodell said that private equity investment in franchise ownership has been “incredibly successful,” giving teams greater financial flexibility and more growth potential.】

item.title: 日本通胀回升，凸显首相面临的挑战
item.description: 由于能源成本上升，日本的关键物价指标也随之上扬，这凸显了新首相佐那江隆一面临的挑战，并使日本央行继续保持进一步加息的步伐。【原文：Japan’s key price measure picked up pace on higher energy costs, underscoring the challenges facing new Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi and keeping the Bank of Japan on track for further rate hikes.】

item.title: 黄金将结束九周连胜，反弹热潮即将退去
item.description: 由于交易商重新评估了将黄金推向过热区域的涨势，黄金在大幅回调后将结束九周连涨。【原文：Gold is set to snap a nine-week winning streak, following a sharp correction as traders reassessed a rally that had pushed the metal into overheated territory.】

item.title: 谷歌 TPU 在芯片问世十年后找到了人工智能需求的甜蜜点
item.description: 在几乎完全由英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp. ）主导的人工智能芯片产业中，谷歌公司十多年前专为人工智能任务开发的芯片终于在其母公司之外获得了发展，成为训练和运行复杂人工智能模型的一种方式。【原文：In an AI chip industry that’s almost entirely commanded by Nvidia Corp., a Google chip first developed more than 10 years ago especially for artificial intelligence tasks is finally gaining momentum outside its home company as a way to train and run complex AI models.】

item.title: 捷豹路虎网络攻击导致英国汽车产量下滑 27
item.description: 使捷豹路虎汽车公司陷入瘫痪的网络攻击导致上个月英国汽车产量骤降 27%，给该国陷入困境的工业带来了更大压力。【原文：The cyberattack that crippled Jaguar Land Rover Automotive Plc caused British car production to plunge 27% last month, piling more pressure on the country’s beleaguered industry.】

item.title: GfK 称，英国人信心回升，开始关注大件采购
item.description: 一项对消费者情绪的长期调查显示，尽管面临增税的威胁，但英国家庭在 10 月份比近四年来的任何时候都更愿意在大件商品上大手大脚。【原文：UK households were more inclined to splash out on big-ticket items in October than at any point in almost four years despite the threat of tax increases, according to a long-running survey of consumer sentiment.】

item.title: 特朗普在高风险会议中寻求与习近平达成难以实现的贸易协议
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）希望在周四与中国总统习近平的关键性会晤中迅速取得胜利，即使会晤结果达不到他所预告的就世界两大经济体之间竞争的核心问题达成的全面协议。【原文：US President Donald Trump is aiming for a quick win in a pivotal Thursday meeting with Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping, even if the outcome falls short of the sweeping deal he’s teased on issues at the heart of the rivalry between the world’s two largest economies.】

item.title: 俄罗斯制裁扰乱市场，石油将在本周大幅上涨
item.description: 美国对俄罗斯主要产油国的制裁扰乱了市场，增加了供应中断的前景和对替代等级石油的更大需求，石油有望创下 6 月份以来的最大单周涨幅。【原文：Oil was on track for the biggest weekly gain since June after US sanctions on major Russian producers upended the market, raising the prospect for supply disruptions and greater demand for alternative grades.】

item.title: 内华达州向加密货币堡垒信托发布禁令
item.description: 据一份法庭文件显示，陷入困境的数字资产托管公司 Fortress Trust —；最近更名为 Elemental Financial Technologies Inc.【原文：Troubled digital-asset custodian Fortress Trust — more recently known as Elemental Financial Technologies Inc. — is on the verge of insolvency and facing a significant mismatch between assets and liabilities, according to a court filing.】

item.title: 甲骨文数据中心 380 亿美元创纪录债务出售在即
item.description: 据知情人士透露，银行正准备最快于下周一发行 380 亿美元的债券，帮助为与甲骨文公司（Oracle Corp. ）有关联的数据中心提供资金，这将是市场上最大的人工智能基础设施交易。【原文：Banks are preparing to launch a $38 billion debt offering as soon as Monday that will help fund data centers tied to Oracle Corp. in what would be the largest such deal for artificial intelligence infrastructure to come to market, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: Advantest 面临关键盈利考验，股价估值超越 Nvidia
item.description: Advantest 公司在这个财报季面临着重大挑战，因为其股价今年飙升了近 80%，使其估值超过了其主要客户 Nvidia 公司的估值。【原文：Advantest Corp. faces a major challenge this earnings season as the nearly 80% surge in its share price this year has pushed its valuations past those of its key customer Nvidia Corp.】

item.title: PG&E 首席执行官 Poppe 认为火灾季结束前不会进行信用升级
item.description: 上个月，PG&E 公司被一家主要评级公司上调了评级，但这家加州最大的公用事业公司预计，在野火季节结束之前，其他公司不会跟进。【原文：While PG&E Corp. was upgraded by one of the major ratings firms last month, California’s biggest utility doesn’t expect others to follow suit until after wildfire season.】

item.title: 在美国 CPI 公布前，亚洲将加入全球股市反弹行列：市场综述
item.description: 周五，亚洲股市将高开，因为有迹象表明华盛顿和北京之间的紧张局势有所缓和，风险情绪有所改善。在美国通胀数据公布前，国债下跌，油价飙升。【原文：Asian stocks were set to open higher Friday as risk sentiment improved on signs of de-escalating tensions between Washington and Beijing. Treasuries fell and oil prices spiked ahead of US inflation data.】

item.title: 各州数据显示美国上周初请失业金人数上升
item.description: 根据对联邦政府停摆期间公布的未经调整的州一级申请数据的分析，上周美国失业救济金申请人数有所增加。【原文：Applications for US unemployment benefits rose last week, according to analyses of unadjusted state-level filings released during the federal government shutdown.】

item.title: 伦敦的 IPO 都去哪儿了？
item.description:
在这部由Bloomberg Originals制作的迷你纪录片中，我们探讨了一个传奇股市回落的原因，以及它为扭转局面所做的努力。【原文：

On this mini-documentary from Bloomberg Originals, we explore the reasons for a storied stock market’s retreat and what it’s doing to turn things around.

】

item.title: 伦敦一度活跃的股市为何陷入困境？
item.description: 伦敦证券交易所失去了魔力。随着公司选择在其他地方上市、将现有上市地转移到美国以及接受私有化交易，这家拥有 300 多年历史的交易所正在萎缩。【原文：The London Stock Exchange has lost its mojo. The more than 300-year-old bourse is shrinking as companies opt to go public elsewhere, shift their existing listings to the US, and accept deals to be taken private.】

item.title: YouTube TV 用户有可能无法收看迪士尼的 ESPN 和 ABC 节目
item.description: 迪斯尼公司（Walt Disney Co.）的 ESPN 和 ABC 频道有可能在 Alphabet 公司的 YouTube 电视服务上消失，因为两家公司之间的协议将于下周到期。【原文：Walt Disney Co.’s ESPN and ABC channels are at risk of going dark on Alphabet Inc.’s YouTube TV service when a deal between the two companies expires next week.】

item.title: 贝莱德、Veritas 就 RSA 安全债务谈判寻求建议
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，私募股权支持的 RSA Security 公司的一组贷款人（包括贝莱德公司（BlackRock Inc.【原文：A group of lenders to private equity-backed RSA Security including BlackRock Inc. and Veritas Capital tapped advisers as the company looks to negotiate a deal over its debt load, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: Versant 媒体集团在康卡斯特分拆上市前融资 20 亿美元
item.description: Versant Media Group Inc. 周四筹集了 20 亿美元的杠杆融资，用于向母公司康卡斯特公司（Comcast Corp.【原文：Versant Media Group Inc. raised $2 billion in leveraged financing Thursday to fund a payment to parent Comcast Corp. tied to the cable-channel operator’s spinoff from the owner of NBC and Universal.】

item.title: 伊利诺伊州储备金攀升，评级获穆迪上调
item.description: 作为美国评级最差的州，伊利诺伊州因储备金增加和财政状况改善而获得穆迪评级公司一个等级的上调。【原文：Illinois, the worst-rated US state, received a one-notch upgrade from Moody’s Ratings for its rising reserves and improving finances.】

item.title: 银行储备第二周下降，跌幅扩大至 3 万亿美元以下
item.description: 作为美联储决定继续缩减资产负债表的一个关键因素，美国银行系统的储备金连续第二周下滑，进一步跌破 3 万亿美元，而此时美联储正准备确定其资产负债表的走向。【原文：The US banking system’s reserves, a key factor in the Federal Reserve’s decision to keep shrinking its balance sheet, tumbled for the second straight week further below $3 trillion just as the central bank is set to determine the path for its balance sheet.】

item.title: 纽蒙特控制成本，实现超预期收益
item.description: 纽蒙特公司（Newmont Corp.）的季度盈利强于预期，因为这家全球最大的黄金开采商在贵金属价格飙升之际控制了成本。【原文：Newmont Corp. delivered stronger-than-expected quarterly earnings as the world’s largest gold miner contained costs at a time of surging precious metal prices.】

item.title: 销售放缓，应用材料公司将裁减全球 4% 的员工
item.description: 美国最大的芯片制造设备生产商应用材料公司（Applied Materials Inc.【原文：Applied Materials Inc., the largest US producer of chipmaking equipment, plans to cut 4% of its global workforce as it copes with a sales slowdown and trade turmoil.】

item.title: 谷歌与 Anthropic 宣布达成价值数百亿美元的云计算交易
item.description: Alphabet Inc.旗下的谷歌公司将向Anthropic PBC公司提供多达100万个专用人工智能芯片，这笔价值数百亿美元的交易加深了谷歌与这家快速发展的人工智能初创公司的合作关系。【原文：Alphabet Inc.’s Google will supply up to 1 million of its specialized AI chips to Anthropic PBC, a deal worth tens of billions of dollars that deepens its partnership with the fast-growing artificial intelligence startup.】

item.title: 蒙牛集团斯科拉认为美国消费者 "受挤压 "压力渐增
item.description: Monarch Alternative Capital LP 的联席首席投资官亚当-斯克拉尔（Adam Sklar）认为，Tricolor Holdings 和 First Brands Group 的破产引发了有关承销和尽职调查做法的争论，但企业信贷中更大的问题来自美国经济的痛点。【原文：The blow-ups of Tricolor Holdings and First Brands Group have sparked debates about underwriting and due diligence practices, but the bigger problem in the corporate credit is coming from pain points in the US economy, according to Adam Sklar, co-chief investment officer at Monarch Alternative Capital LP.】

item.title: 人工智能创作者已经开始占领社交平台并获取报酬
item.description:
"Granny Spills "和 "Xania Monet "的创作者们赚取了数千美元，影响了数百万人

。【原文：

The creators of “Granny Spills” and Xania Monet are making thousands of dollars and reaching millions of people

】

item.title: 个人电脑芯片市场回暖，英特尔作出令人鼓舞的预测
item.description: 在个人电脑需求增长之后，英特尔公司（Intel Corp. ）给出了乐观的收入预期，从而提振了人们对这家陷入困境的芯片制造商卷土重来的乐观情绪。【原文：Intel Corp. gave an upbeat revenue forecast after personal computer demand grew, boosting optimism about a comeback attempt by the embattled chipmaker.】
